document.docAuthor: Sankaran, Pradeep M. & Sebastian, Pothalil A.
document.docTitle: Polydrepanum fissum Sankaran & Sebastian 2018, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of and a new transfer from the millipede genus Polydrepanum Carl, 1932 (Polydesmida, Paradoxosomatidae, Polydrepanini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of and a new transfer from the millipede genus Polydrepanum Carl, 1932 (Polydesmida, Paradoxosomatidae, Polydrepanini)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material: Holotype :
Male (MILLI-ADSH0005),
INDIA :
Tamil Nadu
: Salem , Yercaud , near the foothills of Kiliyur Falls , 11o47'45.1''N , 78o12'02.6''E ,
1167 m
alt.,
3 December 2017
, M. S. Pradeep leg., from litter, by hand
.
Paratypes : 2 males (MILLI-ADSH0006), same data as holotype
.

Etymology. The specific epithet refers to the bifurcated solenophore tip of the new species ( Fig. 4A , 1 st and 2nd arrows). Latin
fissum
= split, neuter.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1. A : Field photograph of
Polydrepanum fissum
sp. nov.
. B : Kiliyur Falls. Photo courtesy Jimmy Paul.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Polydrepanum fissum
sp. nov.
seems to be especially similar to
P. tamilum
, at least concerning the complexity of the gonopods, but can be distinguished from the latter by the following combination of characters: femorite with a lateral thumb-like process and paired apical folds (femorite of
P. tamilum
lacks such modifications), solenophore with a moderately and regularly curved distal part (solenophore of
P. tamilum
with a strongly curved/coiled distal part) and solenophore without mesal process (solenophore of
P. tamilum
with paired mesal processes) (compare Figs 3E–F , 4A–C with Carl 1932 : figs 17–18). The occurrence of paired apical demarcation sulci/folds of gonopodal femorite relates
P. fissum
sp. nov.
with the
Polydrepanum
sp. 1 illustrated by Bano and Murthy (1997) . However the complexity of tibiotarsus of the former clearly distinguishes it from the latter (compare Fig. 4A–B with Bano & Murthy 1997 : fig. 10A–B and herein Fig. 6D ).

Description. Male . Body with 20 segments. Length ca 15 mm , width of midbody pro- and metazonites 1.1 and 1.2 mm , respectively. Width of midbody paranota 0.1 mm . Colouration of live animals uniformly chocolate brown; antennae, postero-lateral part of paranota and surface below paranota all chocolate brown; legs and sternites coffee brown. Colouration of alcohol material after preservation faded to brownish, postero-lateral part of paranota pale brown, sternites and legs straw coloured.

Head slightly wider than collum with paranota (1.4/ 1.3 mm ) in dorsal view ( Fig. 2C ); relative ring widths: collum ± 1 ~ 2 <3 <(4 = 16)> 17> 18> 19. Vertex shiny, sparsely setose; frons, stipes, cardo, clypeus moderately setose; epicranial sulcus distinct, ending at midanterior level of antennal sockets. Antennae moderately long (3.0 mm), filiform, reaching dorsally until waist of ring 4; relative antennomere lengths: 2 <3> 4 <5> 6; antennomere 6 widest apically; post-antennal groove shallow; antennal socket diameter and isthmus between them 0.2 and 0.3 mm , respectively.
Pleural keels well marked on haplosegments as triangular bulging, that on diplosegments less evident as narrow thickenings.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Polydrepanum fissum
sp. nov.
. A : Male habitus, mesal view. B : Same, frontal view. C : Anterior part of body, dorsal view. D : Haplosegments, dorsal view. E : Same, mesal view. F : Diplosegments 1–3, dorsal view. G : Diplosegments 7–9, dorsal view. H : Same, mesal view. I : Gnathochilarium, ventral view. J : ‘Teeth’, ventral view. K : Posterior part of body, dorsal view. L : Same, ventral view. M : Same, mesal view. N : Sternal lamella between coxae 4, ventral view. O : Gonopore on conical process of leg 2 coxae, ventral view. P : Gonopod aperture, ventral view. Scale bars : A 2 mm; C, F–G 1 mm; B, D–E, H–I, K– M 0.5 mm; J, N–P 0.2 mm.

FIGURE 3.
Polydrepanum fissum
sp. nov.
, male legs (A–D) and gonopod (E–F). A : Leg pair I, ventral view (insets adenostyle on right femur 1, lateral view (left) and tarsus of the right leg showing tarsal brush, lateral view (right)). B : Left leg of haplosegment 2, mesal view (inset tarsus of the same showing tarsal brush, mesal view). C : Left leg of haplosegment 3, mesal view (inset tarsus of the same showing tarsal brush, mesal view). D : Tarsus of right anterior leg of diplosegment 4 showing tarsal brush, mesal view. E : Right gonopod, ventral view. F : Same, mesal view. Scale bars : A–C, E–F 0.5 mm; D 0.2 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Legs slender, with well developed tarsal brushes ( Fig. 3A–D ), with short claws; all coxae and prefemora bearing a single, ventral, stiff, long seta; relative podomere lengths: femur> tarsus> postfemur> (prefemur ~ tibia); all prefemora swollen laterally; leg pair I possesses small, rounded, midway, ventral tubercle/adentostyle ( Fig. 3A , left inset) on femur; femora on leg pair II ventrobasally with a prominent conical tubercle/ adenostyle ( Fig. 3B ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4.
Polydrepanum fissum
sp. nov.
. A : Right gonopod, ventral view. B : Same, mesal view. C : Same, lateral view. Abbreviations : C = cannula, dlLF = distolateral lobe of femorite, dlLL = distolateral lobe of lamina lateralis, F = femorite, FF = fold of femorite, GC = gonocoxa, LL = lamina lateralis, LLp = lateral lamellate process of solenophore, mLL = mesal extension of lamina lateralis, mTp = mesal triangular process of solenophore, MWp 1 & 2 = membranous wing-like process of solenophore 1 and 2, PF = prefemur, SG = seminal groove, Sm = Solenomere, Sp = Solenophore. Arrows indicate tip of solenomere (3), branches of solenophore tip (1–2) and distoventral, long, stiff seta of prefemur (4). Scale bars : A–B 0.5 mm; C 0.2 mm.

FIGURE 5. Original illustrations of
Telodrepanum badaga Carl, 1932
( A ) and
Polydrepanum implicatum Carl, 1941
( B ) showing structural similarities (reproduced from Carl (1932, 1941)). Arrows indicate sickle-shaped solenophore (1) and postfemoral process (2).

subSubSection.paragraph: Gonopods ( Figs 3E–F , 4A–C ). Gonopod aperture transversely oriented, roughly triangular in outline, about 2/3 as wide as prozonite 7, with a well marked, raised lateral rim, anterior and posterior rims with median projections ( Fig. 2P ). Gonopods high, complex, lying close to sternites. Coxite about as long as femorite, subcylindrical, distally broadened, setose distodorsally ( Figs 3F , 4B ). Cannula as usual ( Fig. 4B ). Prefemur short, globose, as usual densely setose ( Figs 3E–F , 4A–B ), with a moderately long and stiff seta distoventrally ( Fig. 4B, 4 th arrow), with a distal sulcus evidently demarcating acropodite ( Fig. 4A–B ). Femorite long, subcylindrical, with incomplete torsion limited to basal 1/4th part ( Figs 3E–F , 4A–B ), distolaterally with a thumb-like process ( Fig. 4C ). Seminal groove running along dorsal side of femorite, turning laterally near apical folds on femorite, then turning mesally before entering onto solenomere, strongly curved distally ( Fig. 4A ). Postfemoral part clearly set off from femorite by two oblique demarcation sulci/folds ( Fig. 4A–B ). Solenophore short, evidently branched, only with lamina lateralis ( Fig. 4A ), distally curved as a sickle ( Figs 3E , 4A ), with bifurcated tip, lateral branch slightly longer than mesal, both directed laterally ( Fig. 4A , 1 st and 2nd arrows), basomesally with two membranous, triangular, wing-like processes, 1 st large , 2nd small ( Fig. 4B ), with a widely triangular process ( Fig. 4B ), basolaterally with a flat, lamellate process ( Fig. 4C ); lamina lateralis well developed, with a short disolateral process ( Fig. 4C ), with mesal triangular process ( Fig. 4A ), distal 2/3rd folded to juxtapose with the ventral face of solenophore, proximal 1/3rd wide, lying slightly away from solenophore ( Fig. 4A ). Solenomere simple, slender, median part enclosed within lamina lateralis, with moderately exposed, angular tip ( Fig. 4A , 3 rd arrow).
Female . Unknown.

Note.
Polydrepanum fissum
sp. nov.
is quite distinct from other known
Polydrepanum
spp. as its leg pair I possesses adenostyle and gonopodal femorite poorly torsate, which all warrant the erection of a new genus for it. However, a distally sickle-shaped solenophore with only lamina lateralis, a flagelliform solenomere enclosed by the lamina lateralis and the seminal groove, which run along the dorsal face of the femorite fit this species into
Polydrepanum
. The occurrence of adenostyle on leg pair I and gonopodal femorite with less evidence of torsion of
P. fissum
sp. nov.
suggests that it may be a derived clade within
Polydrepanum
, but confirmation requires phylogenetic treatment.
Distribution. Only known from the type locality ( Fig. 7 ).
